title: Jessica Biel promotes her new Facebook Watch drama Limetown
text:
Her new TV series Limetown is set to drop on Facebook Watch on Wednesday.

And Jessica Biel was dressed to impress to promote the gripping new thriller at the Four Seasons hotel in Los Angeles on Monday.

The Hollywood actress, 37, looked elegant in a brown jacket layered over a coordinating polo neck dress.

New project: Jessica Biel was dressed to impress to promote her new Facebook Watch show Limetown at the Four Seasons hotel in Los Angeles on Monday

Jessica matched her footwear to the autumnal colour palette of her clothes, donning a pair of thigh-high suede boots.

The Sinner star, who is married to Justin Timberlake, complemented the earthy tones of her outfit with natural looking make-up.

Limetown follows a radio journalist who is working to unravel the mystery disappearance of hundreds of people.

Chic: The Hollywood actress, 37, looked elegant in a brown jacket layered over a coordinating polo neck dress

Stunning: The Sinner star, who is married to Justin Timberlake, complemented the earthy tones of her outfit with natural looking make-up

Adapted from a wildly popular podcast series, the fictional show documents American Public Radio reporter Lia Haddock's fight to uncover the truth about 300 people missing from a neuroscience research facility in Tennessee.

Fifteen years before her investigation, every single resident of the scientific community vanished without a trace, including Lia's uncle Emile (Stanley Tucci).

Facebook has ordered 10 episodes of the mystery thriller, set to appear on their new Watch platform, which viewers can watch for free on the social media site itself or via an app.

Mysterious: Limetown follows a radio journalist who is working to unravel the mystery disappearance of hundreds of people

Strange: Fifteen years before her investigation, every single resident of a scientific community vanished without a trace

Jessica admitted in a recent interview with EW that she hadn't realised the podcast was a fictional story, much to her embarrassment.

'Well, number one, I thought it was real. I’m going to out myself and say that. [Laughs] Sometimes news cycles go by so quickly [that] I thought, “Oh my gosh, I’ve missed this!”

'I called my producing partner and said, “We have to get involved in this! This is crazy!” and she stopped me and was like, “This isn’t real"...

'It felt topical, it felt terrifying, and it was just so well done and so smart.'

Limetown, which Jessica is also an executive producer on, is adding to an expanding list of projects going up on the platform.

Among the other scripted programs are Elizabeth Olsen's, 30, Sorry For Your Loss and Queen America, starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, 49.
